question.title: Leetflex Banned Accounts
question.content:
Table: LogInfo

+-------------+----------+
| Column Name | Type     |
+-------------+----------+
| account_id  | int      |
| ip_address  | int      |
| login       | datetime |
| logout      | datetime |
+-------------+----------+
There is no primary key for this table, and it may contain duplicates.
The table contains information about the login and logout dates of Leetflex accounts. It also contains the IP address from which the account logged in and out.
It is guaranteed that the logout time is after the login time.


Write an SQL query to find the account_id of the accounts that should be banned from Leetflex. An account should be banned if it was logged in at some moment from two different IP addresses.

Return the result table in any order.

The query result format is in the following example:



LogInfo table:
+------------+------------+---------------------+---------------------+
| account_id | ip_address | login               | logout              |
+------------+------------+---------------------+---------------------+
| 1          | 1          | 2021-02-01 09:00:00 | 2021-02-01 09:30:00 |
| 1          | 2          | 2021-02-01 08:00:00 | 2021-02-01 11:30:00 |
| 2          | 6          | 2021-02-01 20:30:00 | 2021-02-01 22:00:00 |
| 2          | 7          | 2021-02-02 20:30:00 | 2021-02-02 22:00:00 |
| 3          | 9          | 2021-02-01 16:00:00 | 2021-02-01 16:59:59 |
| 3          | 13         | 2021-02-01 17:00:00 | 2021-02-01 17:59:59 |
| 4          | 10         | 2021-02-01 16:00:00 | 2021-02-01 17:00:00 |
| 4          | 11         | 2021-02-01 17:00:00 | 2021-02-01 17:59:59 |
+------------+------------+---------------------+---------------------+

Result table:
+------------+
| account_id |
+------------+
| 1          |
| 4          |
+------------+
Account ID 1 --> The account was active from "2021-02-01 09:00:00" to "2021-02-01 09:30:00" with two different IP addresses (1 and 2). It should be banned.
Account ID 2 --> The account was active from two different addresses (6, 7) but in two different times.
Account ID 3 --> The account was active from two different addresses (9, 13) on the same day but they do not intersect at any moment.
Account ID 4 --> The account was active from "2021-02-01 17:00:00" to "2021-02-01 17:00:00" with two different IP addresses (10 and 11). It should be banned.

rephrased.body:
Given a table `LogInfo` containing information about Leetflex account logins and logouts, identify accounts that should be banned. An account should be banned if it was logged in at the same time from two different IP addresses. The `LogInfo` table has the following columns:

*   `account_id` (int): The ID of the Leetflex account.
*   `ip_address` (int): The IP address used for login/logout.
*   `login` (datetime): The login timestamp.
*   `logout` (datetime): The logout timestamp.

Write an SQL query to return the `account_id` of the accounts that should be banned.

testcases.explanation:
Account ID 1: This account logged in from IP address 1 between 2021-02-01 09:00:00 and 2021-02-01 09:30:00, and from IP address 2 between 2021-02-01 08:00:00 and 2021-02-01 11:30:00.  Since these time intervals overlap, this account should be banned.
Account ID 2: This account used different IP addresses (6 and 7) at different times, so it should not be banned.
Account ID 3: This account used different IP addresses (9 and 13) at different times on the same day with no time overlap, so it should not be banned.
Account ID 4: This account logged in from IP address 10 between 2021-02-01 16:00:00 and 2021-02-01 17:00:00, and from IP address 11 between 2021-02-01 17:00:00 and 2021-02-01 17:59:59. Since these time intervals overlap (specifically at 17:00:00), this account should be banned.
